name: Perplexity
description: Source-grounded answers for scoping questions. Verify primary sources for critical claims.

name: NotebookLM
description: Upload sources → ask questions, get outlines and summaries tied to your material.

name: Semantic Scholar
description: Find relevant papers across disciplines; handy TLDR summaries and citation graphs.

name: Elicit
description: Natural-language queries return relevant papers and extracted key points to jumpstart reviews.

name: SciSpace Copilot
description: Ask questions alongside PDFs; get simpler explanations of math, tables, and graphs.

name: ChatPDF
description: Upload papers and ask targeted questions to extract passages and summaries.

name: Scite
description: See whether later studies support or contrast a paper’s claims with classification labels.

name: Consensus
description: Synthesizes findings from multiple papers to answer research questions with citations.

name: Zotero
description: Collect and organize PDFs, cite in your documents; extensible via plugins.

name: Paperpile
description: Clean browser-based manager with fast PDF handling and citation insertion.

name: Writefull
description: Improves grammar and phrasing tailored to scientific styles; integrates with editors.

name: Grammarly
description: Grammar and style suggestions; use cautiously for technical text.

name: GitHub Copilot
description: Autocomplete and code suggestions in IDEs; always review and test outputs.

name: ChatGPT (Advanced Data Analysis)
description: Upload datasets and get code, charts, and analyses—verify all stats and methods.
categories: Coding, stats, & automation, General research assistants & chatbots

name: PandasAI
description: Ask questions of your DataFrames; inspects and generates Python code for you to run.

name: Kanaries RATH
description: Auto-insights and visualization generation; helpful for exploration.

name: NVivo
description: Code qualitative data, use ML to auto-suggest themes; review manually for accuracy.

name: ATLAS.ti
description: Auto-generate descriptive codes and summaries—use with caution for sensitive data.

name: Otter.ai
description: Record meetings and interviews, generate notes and highlights; proofread for accuracy.

name: OpenAI Whisper
description: Run locally for privacy; strong multilingual accuracy; CLI usage required.

name: Qualtrics XM (Text iQ)
description: Theme detection and sentiment for open-ended responses; best with large samples.

name: SurveyMonkey + Genius
description: Draft surveys and summarize results; pilot test AI-generated questions.

name: BioRender
description: Drag-and-drop templates and icons for accurate schematics; good for papers and talks.

name: DALL·E 3
description: Produce conceptual illustrations—label AI images and avoid misuse for scientific evidence.

name: Gradescope
description: Group similar answers to speed grading; instructors verify groups.

name: Turnitin (Originality & AI Writing)
description: Use similarity reports to open dialogue; AI detectors can be unreliable—interpret cautiously.

name: Benchling
description: Collaborative lab notebook with AI helpers and inventory; institutional tool.

name: Protocol Builder
description: Templates and AI-assisted text for protocols and consent—requires thorough review.

name: Notion AI
description: Ask questions of your workspace and summarize notes; mind privacy and accuracy.

name: Slack GPT
description: Experimental features that help keep up with busy channels—use with team guidelines.

name: Claude
description: Anthropic’s assistant designed for helpful and honest responses; good for summarizing, brainstorming, and Q&A with a focus on safety.

name: Gemini (Bard)
description: Google’s large language model integrated with search; provides conversational answers, drafts and coding help; verify details against primary sources.

name: YouChat
description: Part of the You.com platform, offering generative answers with clickable citations; useful for quick facts and brainstorming, but sources vary in quality.

name: Research Buddy
description: AI tool aimed at students for literature reviews, Q&A and dataset discovery; provides templated outputs; always verify citations.

name: MirrorThink
description: Narrowly focused assistant to answer methods and paper questions quickly; limited public documentation, so cross-check outputs with trusted sources.

name: Iris.ai
description: Platform providing smart search, reading list analysis, data extraction and citation-backed chat; emphasises provenance and is geared toward enterprise R&D.

name: ChatSonic
description: Chatbot that builds on GPT models and can adopt various personas; includes web search and image generation; verify factual accuracy.

name: Paperguide
description: All-in-one co‑pilot for scoping reviews: searches literature, summarizes papers, and organizes them into projects with source-linked notes.

name: Laser AI
description: Enterprise platform for systematic and living reviews with assisted screening, data extraction, and quality appraisal; requires structured workflows.

name: System Pro
description: Combines AI with a knowledge graph to surface concepts, context and related literature beyond simple keyword search; newer entrant, so check coverage.

name: STORM
description: Stanford prototypes (STORM/Co-STORM) build Wikipedia‑like topic briefs and enable collaborative question answering; experimental and open-source.

name: Mify
description: Turns prompts or documents into interactive mind maps, helping you structure themes for literature reviews; includes PDF-to-map and mobile apps.

name: arXiv Pulse
description: Personalized digest summarizing new arXiv preprints in your chosen field; a great way to stay current without daily skimming; remember preprints aren’t peer-reviewed.

name: Connected Papers
description: Creates a graph of related papers based on co-citation and bibliographic coupling, helping you explore new directions and identify influential works.

name: ResearchRabbit
description: Recommends papers and authors using citation networks and displays them as interactive graphs; good for discovering connections and keeping up‑to‑date.

name: Litmaps
description: Generate visual maps of literature based on citations; explore topics and track new papers through alerts; sync with reference managers.

name: Inciteful
description: Search engine and citation tool that uses citation networks to find overlooked but relevant papers; helps generate reading lists and recommendations.

name: Aether Brain
description: GPT‑powered assistant focused on explaining research papers, breaking down complex methods and figures into plain language.

name: Petal
description: AI reader designed for rapid familiarization with long documents; chat with PDFs and ask questions to obtain key information quickly.

name: Humata
description: Upload PDFs and ask questions; the tool provides snippet‑backed answers and summaries, supporting long documents and scientific papers.

name: Lateral AI
description: An AI reading and organization workspace (sunset in 2025) formerly offering cross‑document search and notes; existing users can still access archives.

name: Paper Brain
description: Reader that extracts key points, definitions and questions from papers; great for a quick 'what’s this about?' pass on new literature.

name: Anara
description: Summarize and ask questions over PDFs, links and other documents; supports cross‑document themes and quick synthesis.

name: Sharly.ai
description: Offers summaries, citations and cross‑document comparisons, making it easy to discuss and contrast findings across a corpus.

name: OpenRead
description: Interactive paper reader with question answering and section‑wise explanations; good for learning core claims and methods quickly.

name: DocAnalyzer AI
description: Handles large collections of documents with shareable links and team workspaces; provides labeling and Q&A for corpora.

name: Scholarcy
description: Automatically creates highlights, summaries and flashcards from academic papers; useful for quickly distilling key information.

name: ExplainPaper
description: Provides plain‑English explanations of complex passages in scientific papers; great for clarifying dense paragraphs and equations.

name: OpenAlex
description: Massive open database of scholarly works, authors, institutions and citations; can be used to explore citation networks and evaluate research impact.

name: Citation Gecko
description: Browser-based tool that helps you discover relevant papers by exploring citation networks from a set of seed articles.

name: Altmetric
description: Tracks and visualizes online attention (news, social media, policy documents) around academic outputs; complements citation counts.

name: Dimensions.ai
description: Provides bibliometrics, citations and grant data across millions of publications, helping evaluate influence and collaboration patterns.

name: Retraction Watch Database
description: Searchable catalog of retracted articles and notices, useful for checking the integrity of cited works.

name: PubPeer
description: Platform where researchers discuss and critique published papers; helpful to see if findings have been challenged or corrected.

name: EvidenceHunt
description: Tool designed to search for and synthesize evidence from clinical studies, capturing trial outcomes and confidence intervals; still evolving.

name: Scimago Journal & Country Rank
description: Simple portal to view impact factors, Eigenfactor scores and citation distributions for journals; use as a rough indicator, not a definitive ranking.

name: Mendeley
description: Desktop and cloud tool to collect, organize and cite research papers; offers group libraries and literature recommendations.

name: EndNote
description: Long-standing reference manager with powerful sorting, note-taking and citation insertion features; integrates with Word and popular databases.

name: SciWheel
description: Formerly F1000Workspace, combines reference management with literature discovery and collaborative manuscript writing.

name: JabRef
description: Desktop application for managing bibliographies; integrates with LaTeX and supports linking PDFs and notes.

name: Citavi
description: Reference manager with task planning and knowledge organization features; supports Windows and cloud editions.

name: RefWorks
description: Cloud citation management from ProQuest with collaboration features and direct import from databases; often licensed institutionally.

name: BibGuru
description: Generate and manage citations quickly in multiple styles; ideal for students needing fast bibliography creation.

name: Mendeley Cite
description: Lightweight plug‑in that works with Mendeley libraries to insert and format citations inside Microsoft Word and Office 365.

name: Jenni AI
description: Generates sentences and paragraphs for academic essays and can suggest real references from databases like OpenAlex; always verify citations.

name: Yomu
description: Helps draft and refine essays, papers and theses with discipline-aware feedback; integrates research and writing workflow.

name: Wisio
description: Provides topic advice, drafting support, translation and citation lookup for scientific manuscripts; integrates with PubMed.

name: ThesisAI
description: Ingests multiple papers to generate a structured literature review with inline citations; demands thorough fact-checking and rewriting for accuracy.

name: Paperpal
description: AI copy editor that improves grammar, syntax and clarity in academic manuscripts; supports multiple subject areas.

name: Trinka
description: Tailored grammar and language suggestions for technical and academic writing; includes subject-specific phrase recommendations.

name: DeepL Write
description: From the makers of DeepL Translator; rewrites sentences and paragraphs to improve style and fluency while preserving meaning; supports multiple languages.

name: Wordtune
description: Suggests rephrasings of sentences to improve clarity, tone and flow; includes formal and casual modes; not specific to academia but useful for polishing drafts.

name: Codeium
description: Offers AI-powered code completions across multiple IDEs; can be self-hosted for privacy; always review generated code for license and correctness.

name: Amazon Q Developer
description: Generates code suggestions and full functions in real time, with support for AWS integrations; free for individual use.

name: Tabnine
tagline: AI code suggestions for many languages.
description: Predictive coding assistant that offers context-aware completions; available offline/on-prem for teams concerned about privacy.

name: Replit Ghostwriter
description: Replit’s built-in assistant helps you write and debug code directly in the browser-based IDE; free tier available.

name: Jupyter AI
description: Extension for JupyterLab that lets you chat with an LLM about your code and data; can generate code and explain outputs; requires internet connectivity.

name: Wolfram Alpha
description: Provides answers to math, science and data queries using curated knowledge and symbolic computation; integrates with Mathematica and ChatGPT.

name: RTutor.ai
description: AI assistant that writes R code to analyze your data based on plain language questions; useful for quick EDA and charts; check code before running.

name: Julius AI
tagline: Chat to your spreadsheets and databases.
description: Connect spreadsheets or databases and ask for charts, statistics or queries in plain language; supports notebooks and secure SOC 2/TX-RAMP compliance.

name: Excel Analyze Data
description: Microsoft Excel’s built-in AI feature (formerly Ideas) generates charts, pivot tables and answers to natural-language questions based on spreadsheet data.

name: Undetectable AI
description: Aims to evade AI text detection; marketing tool not suited for scholarly writing; using such tools may violate academic integrity policies.

name: Afforai (Logically.app)
description: Rebranded workspace combining reference management, literature review support, annotation and drafting; produces cite-grounded summaries and comparison pages.

name: Granted AI
description: Trained on proposal patterns, this tool generates sections of grant applications and offers on-the-fly structuring; always attach real data and budgets.

name: DataRobot
description: AutoML system that builds and compares models automatically; good for predictive modeling but requires understanding of data and evaluation metrics.

name: Tableau Ask Data
description: Feature of Tableau that allows users to ask questions about their data and automatically create visualizations; works best with well-structured datasets.

name: IBM Watson Analytics
description: Cloud-based analytics that applies AI to discover patterns and build predictive models with interactive dashboards; verify results carefully.

name: Kaggle Notebooks AI
description: On Kaggle’s platform you can now get code suggestions and explanations for analyses directly in notebooks; great for data competitions and exploration.

name: MAXQDA
description: Industry-standard qualitative data analysis package with AI-assisted coding, sentiment analysis and visualization; cross-platform.

name: Dedoose
description: Browser-based platform for qualitative and mixed-methods research; supports coding, memos and collaborative teamwork.

name: Taguette
description: Free and open-source tool for qualitative coding; runs locally or on a server; great for teaching and small projects.

name: Quirkos
description: User-friendly qualitative analysis with bubble-based visualization of codes; helpful for small to medium projects.

name: WebQDA
description: Portuguese-developed web platform for qualitative data analysis and collaboration; supports coding and memoing.

name: QDA Miner
description: Combines qualitative coding with quantitative content analysis and text mining; integrates with WordStat for advanced analytics.

name: QCAmap
description: Web-based tool to assist with qualitative content analysis following Mayring’s methodology; supports coding and category development.

name: QDAcity
description: Team-based QDA platform that supports annotation, memoing and project management; offers AI-assisted coding suggestions.

name: Descript
description: Transcription and audio/video editing platform where edits to the text automatically reflect in the media; includes AI voice cloning (with consent).

name: Fireflies.ai
description: Records meetings, provides searchable transcripts, identifies action items and integrates with calendar and collaboration tools.

name: Zoom AI Companion
description: Zoom’s AI Companion generates meeting summaries, chapters and next-step suggestions; quality can vary, so review before sharing.

name: Trint
description: Provides fast, automated transcription with an editor to refine text; supports multiple languages and exports.

name: HappyScribe
description: Web-based transcription and subtitles generation tool; offers team collaboration and human-corrected transcripts as an option.

name: Rev.ai
description: Automatic and human transcription services via API or web interface; widely used for research and media.

name: Sonix.ai
description: AI transcription and translation platform with collaborative editing and search across files; supports many languages.

name: Loom
description: Record short video messages that automatically include transcripts and captions; useful for sharing quick updates or tutorials.

name: Thematic
description: Analyzes qualitative survey responses and uncovers themes using AI and NLP; suited for large datasets; always review the results manually.

name: Typeform
description: Create engaging, conversational surveys; includes a feature for AI-generated questions and summary insights; test for bias before deployment.

name: Alchemer
description: Formerly SurveyGizmo; offers advanced survey design, logic and AI insights; widely used in research and customer feedback.

name: Dovetail
description: Customer and user research platform that organizes notes, transcripts and surveys, with automated tagging and sentiment analysis.

name: Clarabridge
description: Enterprise text analytics platform that extracts sentiment and intent from open feedback across channels; heavy-duty solution.

name: SurveySparrow
description: Survey platform with chat‑like surveys, NPS and 360 reviews; includes conversational analytics and integrations.

name: Qualaroo
description: Collects contextual feedback via website pop-ups and analyzes responses using sentiment and theme detection.

name: Medallia
description: Provides pre-built and custom machine learning models to analyze sentiment, intent, topics and keywords in survey responses and other text data.

name: Eraser AI
description: Transforms plain-English descriptions into flowcharts automatically; good for quickly sketching algorithms or workflows, but complex flows may need refinement.

name: Midjourney
description: Generates high-quality artistic images from textual prompts via Discord; not suitable for scientific diagrams; credit required when using images.

name: Stable Diffusion
description: Generative model that can be locally run to produce images from text prompts; can be fine‑tuned; ensure transparency when using generated images in research.

name: Microsoft Designer
description: Part of Microsoft 365; helps generate professional-looking designs, social media posts and graphics quickly using AI suggestions.

name: Canva Magic Design
description: Canva’s AI system generates design drafts based on your content and preferences; useful for slides and posters but check for scientific accuracy.

name: Genially
description: Tool for creating interactive presentations, infographics and storytelling visuals; includes AI suggestions; good for teaching and outreach.

name: Venngage
description: Generates a variety of charts and dashboards from datasets using AI; tailor the charts to your audience and verify accuracy.

name: Khanmigo
description: Experimental tutor that guides students through problems step-by-step rather than giving answers; helps teachers draft lesson plans and quizzes.

name: Quizlet Q-Chat
description: GPT-powered chat mode that helps students learn with flashcards by asking and answering questions; best used alongside human-checked materials.

name: Quillionz
description: Generates quizzes and question sets from source material; good starting point for assessments but requires review to ensure accuracy and fairness.

name: Squirrel AI
description: Chinese adaptive learning platform that creates individualized study plans and provides AI-driven instruction across subjects.

name: Century Tech
description: Platform that uses AI to tailor learning paths for students, monitor progress and provide analytics to teachers; emphasises mastery-based learning.

name: GPTZero
description: One of the early free web tools to estimate whether text is AI-written using perplexity and burstiness; prone to false positives/negatives—use with caution.

name: Ouriginal (Urkund)
description: Well-established plagiarism detection system, now part of Turnitin, focusing on similarity checking; does not specifically detect AI writing.

name: CopyLeaks AI Detector
description: Detects plagiarized and AI-generated content with a machine-learning model; useful to supplement human judgment.

name: ZeroGPT
description: Analyzes text to predict the likelihood it was generated by AI; accuracy varies; treat results as preliminary.

name: Originality.ai
tagline: AI and plagiarism scanning for professionals.
description: Subscription service that scans content for plagiarism and AI generation; often used by publishers and agencies.

name: Plagscan
description: Traditional similarity checking tool used by universities; compares documents against a large database; doesn’t detect AI text.

name: iThenticate
description: Used by journals and publishers to scan manuscripts for overlap with published literature; part of Turnitin; does not detect AI writing.

name: PaperRater
description: Free online tool that evaluates grammar, spelling and originality; suitable for students seeking feedback on drafts; accuracy varies.

name: Colabra
description: AI-enhanced electronic lab notebook for research teams, offering experiment tracking, protocol templates and insights across projects.

name: LabArchives
description: Widely used ELN that helps labs store, organize and share experimental records; offers compliance with regulatory standards.

name: Labguru
description: Combines lab notebook, inventory, and project management; includes protocol management and scheduling tools.

name: eLabFTW
description: Self-hosted electronic lab notebook with inventory management and scheduling; free and open-source, with strong security features.

name: SciNote
description: Electronic lab notebook combined with project and data management; includes AI suggestions for experiment planning.

name: RSpace
description: Electronic lab notebook designed for research teams; integrates with institutional repositories and storage; cloud and on-prem options.

name: LabTwin
description: Digital assistant for lab work that captures notes via voice commands, logs data and assists with protocol steps; hands-free operation.

name: DMPTool
description: Guides researchers through creating funder-compliant Data Management Plans with templates and example language; helps ensure data sharing requirements are met.

name: DMPonline
description: UK-based platform similar to DMPTool for drafting Data Management Plans tailored to funder and institutional requirements.

name: ConsentBuilder
description: Offers templates and AI-assisted text suggestions to draft readable informed consent documents; still requires customization and review.

name: DataSeer
description: Analyzes manuscripts to see if data sharing requirements are met and suggests actions; helps ensure compliance with funders and journals.

name: AI Fairness 360
tagline: Toolkit for detecting bias in AI.
description: Open-source library from IBM to evaluate and mitigate algorithmic bias; supports multiple bias metrics and mitigation strategies.

name: Glean
description: AI-powered search that indexes your organization’s documents, wikis and emails to help you find information quickly across platforms; requires institutional deployment.

name: PrivateGPT
description: Open-source solution allowing you to query your PDFs and text files via a local large language model to preserve privacy; requires technical setup.

name: Guru
tagline: Team knowledge base with AI suggestions.
description: Centralized knowledge repository that surfaces answers and recommendations in Slack and other tools; ensures information stays up-to-date.

name: Lark AI
tagline: Docs and communication in one platform.
description: Suite of collaboration tools including docs, chat, calendars and AI features like summarization and translation; strong in mobile and Asia-Pacific markets.

name: Slite AI
description: Knowledge-sharing platform with AI that answers questions about your team’s docs and helps draft meeting notes and summaries.

name: Coda AI
description: All-in-one doc platform with AI that can summarize pages, extract action items and generate content; great for meeting notes and project planning.

name: Quip AI
description: Salesforce’s collaboration platform with AI-driven content and summaries, integrated chat and spreadsheets; targeted at enterprise teams.

name: Microsoft Copilot for 365
description: Generative AI baked into Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook to draft, summarize and analyze content; enterprise preview rollout; verify outputs.

name: LabCollector
tagline: Inventory management and ELN for labs.
description: LabCollector is a modular laboratory management solution with inventory tracking, electronic notebooks, and project management features for research teams.

name: RStudio Cloud
description: Cloud-based RStudio for coding, stats and reproducible analysis.

name: JASP
description: Open-source software with GUI for Bayesian and classical stats.

name: Jamovi
description: Open-source stats package built on R, easy point-and-click interface.

name: Google Colab
description: Free hosted Jupyter notebooks with GPU/TPU support.

name: VS Code Notebooks
description: Integrated Jupyter notebooks inside Visual Studio Code IDE.

name: Orange Data Mining
description: Drag-and-drop widgets for ML, text mining and bioinformatics.

name: KNIME
description: Open platform for data analytics, blending code and visual flows.

name: Stata SE
description: Industry-standard commercial suite for stats and econometrics.

name: MATLAB Online
description: Use MATLAB functions online for coding, modeling, simulation.

name: SAS OnDemand
description: Free SAS software in the cloud for teaching and learning.

name: Tableau Public
description: Create and share interactive dashboards and visualizations.

name: Power BI
description: Create and share business analytics dashboards.

name: Plotly
description: Python and JS libraries for interactive data viz.

name: D3.js
description: Low-level but powerful library for custom visualizations.

name: Gephi
description: Open-source tool for visualizing and analyzing networks.

name: RAWGraphs
description: Transform spreadsheets into visualizations easily.

name: Metabase
description: Open-source BI tool for visualizing and querying data.

name: Qlik Sense
description: Data visualization and discovery tool with associative model.

name: Looker Studio
description: Free dashboarding tool formerly Data Studio.

name: Excel Power Query
description: ETL features in Excel to clean and combine data sources.

name: RQDA
description: Free R package for computer-assisted qualitative data analysis.

name: CATMA
description: Collaborative annotation for literary and linguistic research.

name: QDA Miner Lite
description: Free version of QDA Miner for text coding.

name: F4analyse
description: Lightweight tool for coding and analyzing transcripts.

name: Transana
description: Analyze and code video and audio data.
